content.description:
This is the face that you see from the trail. 

  Stand start on big blocky holds and decent feet. climb up and left topping out just left of the arete. The crux is near the top when you have to make a move left to avoid the terrible slopers that continue straight up.
content.location: On the Premier Boulder. This route climbs the middle of the face that faces the trail.

content.description:
This is a fun linkup traverse that gives you another option on this boulder. It also serves as a great warm up if you're at this boulder to prepare for a day of hard climbing at the main Den areas. 

  Start standing (or sitting) as per 'Aretascious' and traverse left using holds in the seam and below until reaching the left arete. Either drop off and call it good, or finish up 'Advantageous' to get a few more moves in.
content.protection: A couple of pads if you'd like. Your feet are never more than two feet off the ground.
content.location: Located on The Premiere boulder which is the first boulder in Devil's Den. It is visible on your left, about 60 feet off the trail, just before arriving at the Ridgeline area.

content.description: Sit start on the right arete of the face that faces the trail. Pull off the ground (crux) and make enjoyable moves to an mellow top out.
content.location: On the Premier Boulder. This is the right arete of the face that you see from the trail.

content.description:
Sit start on the left arete of the face the faces the trail. 

  Make a strenuous move (crux) off the ground to better holds, continue up the arete making powerful and technical moves. The top out can be a little heady if at your limit.
content.location: On the Premier Boulder. This is the left arete on the face that faces the trail.

content.description: This is a decent sized boulder located in the bottom of the Den. It has several quality warm-ups and link-ups.
